ratings.comment: I really enjoy Briana's lectures. She's experienced in teaching this course with clear explanation of concepts and well-structured practices. The in-person lecture is highly recommended!! Her lecture is very engaging and she makes the concept easy to understand. Always learned a lot after attending the lecture. Workload is fine.
Super nice professor. I really like her teaching style.
Awesome class learn a lot about derivative securities during the semester.
Briana is impossible to understand during lecture, and her poor grammar makes quizzes and tests more about decrypting what she's asking than the material. Take anyone else - avoid at all costs!

(Reviewed during Coronavirus, remote learning classes). Professor Chang's class was extremely obtuse, confusing, and frustrating. Most work was group work facilitated through Piazza. Class expectations were confusing and often conflicted with the syllabus. The TA or Prof Chang were not available outside of class and needed to be hounded to get help

It takes a couple of weeks to get used to her class, but everything you need to know is in the slides. Shes not out there to trick you. Also, if you get to know her she oftentimes gives you the benefit of a larger curve.
If you learn by having someone tell you to use your "intuition" you'll do well in this class. Derivatives doesn't seem to be a super "intuitive" topic. Hence the large curve in this class.

Briana is one of the worst professors I have had here at UW-Madison. She talks in circles and often muddles very basic concepts. If you take a class with her, I would be prepared to teach yourself the content. Avoid if you have the opportunity.
God awful... can barely understand anything she says and her lectures are extremely unhelpful. Has useless attendance policy.

I really liked Brianna. Her lecture is very straightforward. She gives us the opportunity to work on problems in class and no curveballs on exam. I think people don't do as well in this class because they get bogged down in all the formulas and the information in her slides. The actual concepts to be very intuitive and no need to memorize formulas.

I really enjoyed Briana as a professor. Her midterm was very fair and she doesn't try to trick you. (Also she can speak English just fine). If you go to class and pay attention, you should have no problem getting at least a B if Finance is your thing.

Derivatives is a hands on class and Briana is a hands on instructor.  She makes lectures very engaging by demanding participation and working problems.  I found her to be nice and helpful, focused on big picture themes and student understanding.  Pay attention in class, work the practice problems, and you'll be fine. No textbook needed.

One of the worst professors Ive had at Madison. Talks in circles about simple subjects, and is absolutely no help with more confusing subjects. It doesn't help that she can hardly speak english and doesn't get her point across very easily as a result. She also takes attendance for lecture.
Really poor and confusing teaching methods. Easy material. Over complicates it. Avoid

Pretty good professor.  You can get by without going to class, but I still recommend going as often as you can.  In-class problems and exercises are extremely helpful in preparing for the tests, but by far the practice exams are the most helpful.  This is a somewhat difficult class, but the topics are pretty interesting.
great lecture and great instructor. Practice in class is great helpful.

Chang is the worst professor I've had at Madison.  She is a horrible lecturer, talks in circles, and does a terrible job teaching the material which isn't all that complicated.  Be prepared to teach yourself and learn from the book.
